tiles.title: Blog
tiles.text: My own personal blog, dedicated to some of the weird and wacky projects I have fallen into

tiles.title: Who am i?
tiles.text: A little word or two on me.</br>Who I am, where I'm from and what I get up to.
tiles.backHTML:
Who am I?

Call me Josh. I am a software engineer hailing from Central Scotland.

I like coffee a little bit too much and as a result of this I consistently find myself counter balancing the caffeine content by writing clean and efficient code.

You’ll usually find me at the gym, breaking something (and then fixing it) or knee deep in a personal project.

This websites current purpose is to showcase some of the interesting things I’ve done. You can find a few links and demonstrations of my work displayed on this website.

Speaking of work, I am currently positioned as a middleware engineer for the NatWest group.

Contact

  kennedn@msn.com

  LinkedIn

tiles.title: About this website
tiles.text: Some information on the rubber bands and string holding this website together.
tiles.backHTML:
About this website

This website is currently self hosting on an Intel NUC (Model NUC5i5RYH), pictured right. It was purchased for £115 as a replacement for my last home server and packs quite a punch.

The website itself is running in a kubernetes cluster on the NUC. The original core of this website was built from scratch using only Jquery and CSS3 transformations to achieve the tiling effects. Recently I have expanded the website with a blog, which I built using Hugo.

As you can see from the statistics, it's usually doing very little. But the cluster does host a surprising number of services, some of which were home grown! For example roomAPI drives my home automation and livestats is powering the table to your right.







CPU
Memory
Download
Upload
Uptime
